definition[0]: a meal at a party or other occasion, in which people serve themselves at a table and then move away to eat
example[1]: The price includes morning coffee, buffet lunch, and afternoon tea.
definition[1]: a place in a railway station, bus station etc where you can buy and eat food or drink
definition[2]: a piece of furniture in which you keep the things you use to serve and eat a meal
definition[3]: if something, especially wind, rain, or the sea, buffets something, it hits it with a lot of force
example[2]: London was buffeted by storms last night.
example[4]: I was weary of being buffeted by life.
explanation[0]: Buffet is often passive in meaning 1 and usually passive in meaning 2
